description: A uniquely colored lory with two main color phases: one with a brownish-black body with a bright orange or yellow bib, and another that is more olive-green. Both have striking orange and red markings.
temperament: Playful, intelligent, and curious. They are known for their comical antics and can be quite affectionate. They are very active and enjoy swinging and playing with toys.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. They have a high-pitched, repetitive call that can be noisy, but they are generally not as loud as a Rainbow or Chattering Lory.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Can learn to mimic a good number of words and sounds. Their voice is high-pitched and they enjoy chattering.
dietaryNeeds: A liquid nectar diet is essential. Commercially prepared formulas are best. Supplement with a variety of soft fruits and some vegetables.
healthPointers: Can live 20+ years. Messy droppings are a given. Prone to fungal infections if their environment is not kept scrupulously clean. They need a lot of toys to keep them occupied.
housing: Can be manageable in an apartment if the owner is diligent about cleaning and can tolerate moderate noise. A cage of at least 30"W x 24"D x 24"H is needed.
